decks.notes: The key principle of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy and slowly building up your own resources. This is achieved through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value and synergy with your creature cards. By managing the board and consistently out-valuing your opponent, you can grind out a win through attrition and careful decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate value and control the game. The deck includes cards that protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and provide additional support with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The focus is on setting up the combo while maintaining board presence and control through cards like Guardian of New Benalia and Seasoned Hallowblade. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful synergy between its key cards.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with efficient creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. By utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, you can ramp up quickly to play powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Collected Company. Skyclave Apparition helps to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the field while Aven Interrupter provides additional disruption. The overall goal is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures while controlling the battlefield.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Elspeth, while also utilizing powerful enchantments like Beza and Pinnacle Starcage to further solidify its control over the game. The goal is to gradually grind the opponent out of resources and secure a victory through superior card advantage and board presence.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with creatures. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to generate value and control the board. The mana base is focused on producing black and white mana efficiently, with lands like Godless Shrine and Concealed Courtyard. Overall, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Pioneer deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm your opponent with fast creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient card draw and selection, along with versatile removal and counter spells, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy. Key cards like Quantum Riddler and Cori-Steel Cutter provide quick aggression, while cards like Riverglide Pathway and Steam Vents help ensure smooth mana production. With a focus on speed and precision, this deck aims to secure a swift victory against opponents in the Pioneer format.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Emberheart Challenger, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage early on. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Stormchaser's Talent to control the board and clear the way for attacks. Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics provide card draw and disruption, while Experimental Synthesizer and Den of the Bugbear offer additional threats. The lands in the deck help ensure consistent mana base for the fast-paced gameplay.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient spells and creatures. By combining prowess triggers with burn spells and a fast creature base, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Key cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, along with powerful instant and sorceries like Reckless Rage and Stormchaser's Talent, help maintain pressure and control the board while dealing damage efficiently. It focuses on maintaining a fast tempo and finishing the game quickly.

The deck revolves around setting up a powerful combo with Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. It focuses on using cards like Fleeting Spirit and Monument to Endurance to support the combo pieces while controlling the board with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes various utility lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium and The Mycosynth Gardens to provide additional options. Overall, the strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent using a combination of cheap and efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, alongside burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower. By leveraging powerful pump spells like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent, the deck aims to close out the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of damage before they can stabilize. The deck also includes spells like Academic Dispute and Stock Up to generate card advantage and maintain tempo.

The main idea of this UR Aggro Pioneer deck is to quickly play low-cost aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger, while utilizing spells like Fiery Impulse and Stormchaser's Talent to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics for added versatility and disruption. The mana base is built around Steam Vents, Spirebluff Canal, and Riverpyre Verge to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for the spells and creatures in the deck.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By efficiently utilizing creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a fast pace throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Torch the Tower and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional reach and flexibility in dealing with threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish a fast tempo and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, and counterspells like High Noon. The deck also features powerful finishers such as Elspeth, Storm Slayer and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game once control has been established. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's powerful spells and ensure consistent access to all colors of mana needed for its powerful spells.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful combos using multiple cards that work together synergistically to create a powerful board state or game-winning play. It utilizes a mix of creatures, spells, and lands to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own win condition. The deck features key cards like Raffine, Scheming Seer, and Tinybones Joins Up, along with powerful combo pieces like Carnage, Crimson Chaos and Bitter Triumph. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and combo potential, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while disrupting opponents with cards like Ouroboroid and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to control the battlefield and overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, leveraging the power of Collected Company to find key creatures at instant speed. The inclusion of cards like Abandoned Air Temple and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional utility and resilience against control or combo strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to generate early pressure and aggression through low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing cards like Novice Inspector and Ornithopter to establish an early board presence, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents. Key cards like Knight-Errant of Eos and Venerated Loxodon help to pump up the team and push for lethal damage. The inclusion of Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition provides removal options to clear the way for attacks. This Boros Aggro deck aims to close out games quickly through a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells.
